Key Arguments: Opposition to censorship and any law empowering ACMA to restrict free communication.
Belief that existing laws are sufficient to protect against hate speech or threats.
Concern that a government body determining truth could lead to dictatorship.
Emphasis on individual responsibility to discern truth and the historical accuracy of some conspiracy theories.
Skepticism about the ability of any committee to impartially determine misinformation due to potential biases.
Advocacy for more debate as a solution to controversies rather than censorship.
Distrust in ACMA's ability to avoid pressuring digital platforms into over-censorship due to penalties.
Main Themes: Bias and impartiality in determining misinformation
Notable Quotes: A Government or Government agency which is a centralised authority who determines what is true or false becomes a dictatorship.
The solution to scientific or political controversies, or other matters, is more debate not censorship.
